intro: Hieracium proceriforme, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. Hieracium proceriforme is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
